pageContext.claim: “Everything red is ISIS. When I took it over, it was a mess. Now, on the bottom, that's the exact same. There is no red. In fact, there's actually a tiny spot, which will be gone by tonight. So that's ISIS -- red, right there -- and the bottom one is how it is today. This just came out 20 minutes ago. So this is ISIS on Election Day -- my election day -- and this is ISIS now.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump showed two maps when he made these remarks: one showing ISIS's territorial control over Syria when he took office and an up-to-date map showing ISIS's near-total loss of territory. Although they have lost the territory they once controlled, ISIS remains a threat, according to U.S. military and intelligence officials, and could mount a resurgence.
